org.numenta.nupic.util

Class SparseBinaryMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractFlatMatrix<T>
      • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractSparseMatrix
        • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix
          • org.numenta.nupic.util.SparseBinaryMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable, FlatMatrix, Matrix, SparseMatrix

    public class SparseBinaryMatrix
extends AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix
implements Persistable
    Implementation of a sparse matrix which contains binary integer values only.
    Author:
    cogmission
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparseBinaryMatrix

        public SparseBinaryMatrix(int[] dimensions)
        Constructs a new SparseBinaryMatrix with the specified dimensions (defaults to row major ordering)
        Parameters:
        dimensions - each indexed value is a dimension size

      • SparseBinaryMatrix

        public SparseBinaryMatrix(int[] dimensions,
                          boolean useColumnMajorOrdering)
        Constructs a new SparseBinaryMatrix with the specified dimensions, allowing the specification of column major ordering if desired. (defaults to row major ordering)
        Parameters:
        dimensions - each indexed value is a dimension size
        useColumnMajorOrdering - if true, indicates column first iteration, otherwise row first iteration is the default (if false).

      • getSlice

        public java.lang.Object getSlice(int... coordinates)
        Returns the slice specified by the passed in coordinates. The array is returned as an object, therefore it is the caller's responsibility to cast the array to the appropriate dimensions.
        Specified by:
        getSlice in class AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix
        Parameters:
        coordinates - the coordinates which specify the returned array
        Returns:
        the array specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified coordinates address an actual value instead of the array holding it.
